attributes.action: Stop Military Servicemen Selling Their Stories To The Press
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I don't blame anyone for taking cash to sell their stories to the newspapers - in a democracy, that is their individual choice - one of their own civil liberties - and UK soldiers are not doing anything that millions of people haven't already done and are currently in the process of doing in - earning cash from their personal experience. 

However, my only fear is the effect of the newspapers bartering on international relations. In an unstable international arena, might this encourage hostage - taking more - if kidnappers (many of whom may well be illiterates and demonstrably aggreived, reactionary and revolutionary) may feel that this may be a good way to finance their political cause - by holding British servicemen to ransom. The MOD should not be reduced to the ranks of Bella magazine - can the UK government not financially compensate individuals, judging each case by its merits, through legal and legitimate means to deter this commercial and potentially dangerous practice ?  This is only my personal opinion of course, peacefully expressed and not intended to cause offence.
